result.execSummary:
The defendant James Timothy Pelky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Timothy Pelky

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant James Timothy Pelky in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def will waive right to an atty and right to jury trial.  Def to enter plea.  Disorderly conduct with domestic.  No contest plea entered.  Right to an atty, constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Court accept waive and found guilty Nothing by def.  Sentence withheld, 1 year probation,  Cost assessed.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post conviction rights

Defendant James Timothy Pelky in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Def has applied for court appt atty.  Def will post the retainer fee by 3-3-15  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Petition for Appointment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order - copy

Defendant James Timothy Pelky in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has requested a court appointed atty.  Form completed today.  Court reviews form with def.  Court will approve court appointed atty.  Court orders $100.00 retainer fee and $50.00 per months c/ 4-1-15.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Timothy Pelky in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Adjournment requested by def.  State has no objection  Court will adjourn   Bond will continue  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
